mdRecord.dcterms:title: Bill, John and Jason Scott to the estate of George Washington, 1799 December 23
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Scott, John
Scott, Jason
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Bill for mourning suits for the following individuals: George W. Custis, A. Rawlins, Mr.? Ferrell, W. Spence, W. Garrett, W. Dowdal, Marcus, Christopher, Frank, Davy, Daniel, from John and James S. Scott, tailors, charged to the Estate of George Washington Decd. The total amount of $78.50 included twelve suits with buttons and a charge of $2.50 for hiring a horse. This bill is the first evidence that the manager, overseers, and house servants all were to wear mourning attire for the period after the death of General Washington. Autograph document signed, 3 pages. Misnumbered on the top right corner as 'MS-2350,' corrected in the catalog book to MS-3050.
